tv.source-info-name: Pluto TV Space guide by TV

programme.title: The New Frontier: WEBB OF LIFE
programme.desc: The James Webb Space Telescope is now operational. Launched aboard an Arianne 5 the 10-billion-dollar spacecraft has deployed successfully and reached its orbit around the Sun.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Living Planet
programme.desc: With continuous observation of arth from orbit scientists have built a data set over time that reveals much about how the Earth breaths and life sustains itself on this living Planet.

programme.title: MOON SHINE
programme.desc: The International drive to return to the Moon is gathering pace, this multi- nation effort is readying to return, stay and utilise the Lunar assets.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Borderland
programme.desc: Deserts and dunes, cliffs and canyons. Although Mars is certainly an alien wasteland, it is a planet with terrestrial formations remarkably similar to those found on Earth.

programme.title: The Fabric of the Cosmos: What Is Space?
programme.desc: Brian Greene reveals space as a dynamic fabric that can stretch, twist, warp, and ripple under the influence of gravity, and explores dark energy, which makes up 70% of the universe.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Shooting Gallery: Asteroids and Comets
programme.desc: Scientist long thought that our solar system consisted of the sun, the planets, and their moons. We soon found that we are far from alone, often coming into contact with asteroids, comets, and other debris.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Danger, Astreroids Ahead
programme.desc: The question often rises is the cost of space exploration really worth it? Could the money be better spent elsewhere.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Juno, Cassini and Beyond
programme.desc: The Cassini space craft has completed its mission over Saturn, Juno has reached its target and has commenced its scientific observations of the giant planet Jupiter.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: The Hot Zone
programme.desc: Mercury is one Earth's closest neighbors, but for centuries it eluded astronomer's best efforts to learn its secrets. But that has changed thanks to missions like Mariner and most recently, Messenger.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Landsat
programme.desc: Take a look at Landsat 8, the advanced planetary explorer with a 900 million dollar price tag! It is designed to peer across multiple wavelengths to reveal complex and ever-changing details that are undetectable by the human eye.

programme.title: Spacetime: Silent companions - Moons in our planetary system
programme.desc: Since the beginning of time, the moon has been our loyal companion in the sky. But other planets also have satellites, more so than Earth. But what are moons really, how did they come about and do they actually even carry primitive life?

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Mars: Red Dawn
programme.desc: Landing a spacecraft on Mars is no easy task given our limited knowledge of the planet. The difference between success and failure can rely on the most minute detail.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The latest updates on the new space hardware about to launch us into the next generation of space flight some rockets and capsules are on time others not so fortunate.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Emissaries
programme.desc: Our solar system is vast, from our own star the Sun to Earth is nearly 150 million kilometers or 1 Astronomical Unit.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Living In Space
programme.desc: How do astronauts cope with living in space? The unique environment, the lack of taste in their food and the smell of canned air all contribute to the stresses of living and working in space.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Stars Above
programme.desc: Stars are a bit like human beings. They can be warm or cold, they come in all kinds of shapes and sizes.

programme.title: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: For an instrument first developed as recently as the 17th century, the telescope has travelled a long way.

programme.title: The New Frontier: The Planet Makers
programme.desc: From the beginnings of our Solar System four and half billion years ago there remains tantalizing clues to its evolution; remnent debris: asteroids and comets.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Orbit
programme.desc: The International Space Station is undoubtedly the jewel in the crown of low Earth orbit; observation post, research lab and class room.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Gravity
programme.desc: Gravity has long been a force that has intrigued scientists. Now, for the first time scientists are probing to detect gravity waves in space as well as mapping the gravity patterns of the moon.

programme.title: EARTH´S EVIL TWIN
programme.desc: Venus is a planet closest to Earth in distance and size, it once may have been as hospitable to life as Earth is now. Then something changed and Venus became shrouded in hot dense toxic clouds.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Planet X
programme.desc: The New Horizons mission continues deeper into space, it’s next target looming close.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Project Mercury Begins - The start of NASA & America's first manned space program. Mars Express - The European Space Agency's Mars Satellite. The Soyuz Launch System - The gradual evolution of Russia's Soyuz launcher.

programme.title: The New Frontier: Shore To Shore
programme.desc: Our seafaring nature has translated well to the space age, seeking to sail out into the unknown in search of riches of one kind or another.

programme.title: The New Frontier: THE NEXT BIG LEAPS
programme.desc: Projects in the works. SunRISE, SPHEREx, NEOS and others, their mission to expand our knowledge of Earth, the surrounding space, Dark Matter, and the earliest galaxies. N

programme.title: The New Frontier: Fresh Eyes
programme.desc: Two new space telescopes are in orbit and completing their shakedown; Gaia and TESS they too will be joined by the James Webb Telescope.

programme.title: Trajectory - Milestones in Space Exploration
programme.desc: Cold War & The Start of the Space Race - Cold War rivalry and the acceleration of space exploration. Servicing Hubble - Preparations for Hubble's final servicing mission. Chasing a Comet - Launch and the difficult path to rendezvous.

programme.title: In the Shadow of the Moon
programme.desc: Between 1968 and 1972, the world watched in awe each time an American spacecraft voyaged to the Moon. Only 12 men walked upon its surface and they remain the only human beings to have stood on another world.

programme.title: The New Frontier: From There To Here
programme.desc: Series introduction and the study of Earth from orbit.

programme.title: Spacetime: Astrobiology - The search for life
programme.desc: Are we alone? A question we ask ourselves every time we gaze deep into the endlessness of space. And the dream of discovering the origins of mankind is as old as civilization itself. Are there other worlds that support life?
